1.text: My son, keep my words, And lay up my commandments with thee.

2.text: Keep my commandments and live, And my teaching as the apple of thine eye.

3.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, Write them upon the table of thy heart.

4.text: Say unto wisdom: ‘Thou art my sister’, And call understanding thy kinswoman;

5.text: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, From the alien woman that maketh smooth her words.

6.text: For at the window of my house I looked forth through my lattice;

7.text: And I beheld among the thoughtless ones, I discerned among the youths, A young man void of understanding,

8.text: Passing through the street near her corner, And he went the way to her house;

9.text: In the twilight, in the evening of the day, In the blackness of night and the darkness.

10.text: And, behold, there met him a woman With the attire of a harlot, and wily of heart.

11.text: She is riotous and rebellious, Her feet abide not in her house;

12.text: Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places, And lieth in wait at every corner.

13.text: So she caught him, and kissed him, And with an impudent face she said unto him:

14.text: Sacrifices of peace-offerings were due from me; This day have I paid my vows.

15.text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, To seek thy face, and I have found thee.

16.text: I have decked my couch with coverlets, With striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.

17.text: I have perfumed my bed With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; Let us solace ourselves with loves.

19.text: For my husband is not at home, He is gone a long journey;

20.text: He hath taken the bag of money with him; He will come home at the full moon.’

21.text: With her much fair speech she causeth him to yield, With the blandishment of her lips she enticeth him away.

22.text: He goeth after her straightway, As an ox that goeth to the slaughter, Or as one in fetters to the correction of the fool;

23.text: Till an arrow strike through his liver; As a bird hasteneth to the snare—And knoweth not that it is at the cost of his life.

24.text: Now therefore, O ye children, hearken unto me, And attend to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Let not thy heart decline to her ways, Go not astray in her paths.

26.text: For she hath cast down many wounded; Yea, a mighty host are all her slain.

27.text: Her house is the way to the nether-world, Going down to the chambers of death.
